class.name: AttributeContainer
class.brief_description: Contains an [AttributeSet] and manages [AttributeBase] and [AttributeBuff] objects.
class.description:
This class is used to manage [AttributeBase] and [AttributeBuff] objects.
You can add, remove and find attributes and buffs using this node.

method.name: add_attribute
method.description: Adds an attribute to the container.

method.name: apply_buff
method.description: Applies a buff to the right attribute(s).

method.name: find_buffed_value
method.description: Finds the buffed value of an attribute using a predicate.

method.name: find_value
method.description: Finds the value of an attribute using a predicate.

method.name: get_attribute_buffed_value_by_name
method.description: Gets the buffed value of an attribute by name. [b]Note:[/b] If an attribute is derived by many others, and a buff has [method AttributeBuff._operate] overloaded, the buffed value will not reflect the real value. Use the [method find_buffed_value] method to get the real value.

method.name: get_attribute_value_by_name
method.description: Gets the value of an attribute by name.

method.name: remove_attribute
method.description: Removes an attribute from the container.

method.name: remove_buff
method.description: Removes a buff from the container.

method.name: setup
method.description: Sets up the container. Call this programmatically in case the [method _ready] method is not called.

method.name: subtract_attribute_buffs_ticks
method.description: Subtracts the passed p_tick value to all timed transient [AttributeBuff] instances durations in the container. Ideal for turn-based games or to handle programmatic resets/updates.

members.member: If set to true, every [AttributeBuff] duration is going to be handled by you.

signal.name: buff_applied
signal.description: Emitted when a buff is applied.

signal.name: buff_dequed
signal.description: Emitted when a buff is dequeued because it is expired.

signal.name: buff_enqued
signal.description: Emitted when a buff is enqueued.

signal.name: buff_removed
signal.description: Emitted when a buff is removed.
